result.execSummary:
The defendant Maryah G Horton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Maryah G Horton is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Maryah G Horton was found guilty of Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Provide a DNA sample; pay DNA surcharge. Pay a forfeiture of $50.00 plus court costs. Amounts due and owing by 10-21-16 or 15 days in HOC.

COURT GRANTS EXPUGEMENT UPON SUCCESSFUL COMPLETION OF THE SENTENCE, IF FINE AND COSTS ARE PAID IN FULL AND THERE ARE NO FURTHER VIOLATIONS
Consecutive to: Any other sentence; Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work, childcare and eldercare. Defendant to report for sentence on 01-28-16.

**02-24-16/Order allowing defendant up to 13 hours a day for release privileges to go to work**

- Court orders that the weapon is NOT to be returned to the defendant.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Maryah G Horton

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Commitment paid in full and faxed to the sheriff's office.

F&C Commitment issued for failure to pay as ordered.
15 days HOC.
DUE & OWING.

Per Inter-Office communication received from the House of Correction:  Order for Cancellation of Huber/Work Release/Electronic Surveillance Privileges Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 303.08(2), 973.09(4), 973.03(4) signed and filed.

Huber/Work Release Modification Request
.
Request for Huber / Work Release Modification received from HOC and filed this date.  This case is assigned and forwarded to Judge  Siefert, Br 47 for review. os
Allowing additional release privileges for work
Court signed order granting defense motion for sentence modification allowing defendant up to 13 hours a day for release privileges to go to work.
Motion for Bail Modification
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. John Siefert, Br. 47, for review. mag
Letter in response to defendant's motion for sentence modification.
Motion for Sentencing Modification

Defendant Maryah G Horton in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Statement heard from the State, defense and defendant.  The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 5 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 4 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work, childcare and eldercare.  Defendant to report for sentence on 1/28/2016.  Court orders that the weapon is NOT to be returned to the defendant. Court orders Defendant to pay a forfeiture of $50 plus court costs.  Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharges.  Amounts due and owing by 10-21-2016 or 15 days in HOC.
  Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Court grants expungement upon successful completion of the sentence, if fine and costs are paid in full and there are no further violations.
  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Sentencing Referral Form received and filed.

Defendant Maryah G Horton in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

 AS TO COUNT ONE: 
Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered. 

ON MOTION OF STATE, COURT ORDERED COUNT TWO:  DISMISSED. 

Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 47  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 21, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Maryah G Horton in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed. court in trial.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 47. lr  Status conference scheduled for 10-20-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Maryah G Horton in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court grants defendant's request for substitution of attorney James Toran  for attorney Michael Plaisted.

Defendant Maryah G Horton in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests a Plea and Sentencing date. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to branch 47.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Maryah G Horton in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. LR  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 09-03-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Maryah G Horton in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 47. lr  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 08-06-2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia or no dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Maryah G Horton in court with attorney Joan E. Zawikowski.  Defendant Maryah G Horton in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant RESERVING RIGHTS TO SUBSTITUTE.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
